titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Philip D. McMaster papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA179

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-01 01:27:04 -0400.

did.unittitle: Philip D. McMaster papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Philip Duryee McMaster, 1891-1973, scientist worked in pathology and microbiology at The Rockefeller University (earlier RIMR) from 1919 until his death in 1973.

[Note: re Dr. McMaster's middle name: In the N.A.S. Biographical Memoir by Walther F. Goebel, "Dury√©e" is accented as indicated. Following an inquiry by Carol Moberg in connection with the printing of the Philip D. McMaster Lecture program, a check was made of documents in Dr. McMaster's file, (Boxes 1 and 2). No evidence of Dr. McMaster's use of the accented form was found. Mrs. McMaster also told Carol Moberg that Dr. McMaster did not put an accent on his middle name. C. Kopp, 16 April 1985]

eventgrp.event: Born September 14, Chestnut Hill, Philadelphia, Pa.
M.D. University of Pennsylvania Medical School
Fellow, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, N.Y.
Member and Professor, Rockefeller University, N.Y.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order, within subject.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Literary and property rights in unpublished writings have been dedicated to the public.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Papers have been presented as an unrestricted gift to The Rockefeller University by Mrs. Philip Duryee McMaster.
The bulk of this collection was received or inventoried: 1973 October-1974 January. One folder (administrative correspondence, box 17) was received or inventoried 1980 June.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: biographical material, correspondence, reports, notes, lectures, manuscripts, and photographs.

did.unittitle: Biographical material; personal and official correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Significance of work (earlier and later editions including draft copies) as written by Dr. McMaster. Identification cards: Civil Defense; Coast Guard; War Manpower Commission; U.S. Naval Receiving Station; OSRD Research Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transcribed from tape as read by Elizabeth McMaster from draft copy by Dr. McMaster. Includes some recollections by Mrs. McMaster Also bound vol. of autobiography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official also includes snapshots taken by Dr. McMaster demonstrating interest in sailing, early interest in sports, and in nature: also some family snapshots

did.unittitle: Selected quotations as collected and kept by Dr. McMaster
Death: RU obituary and obituary from Princeton Alumni Weekly

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some letters of condolence and some correspondence between Elizabeth McMaster and RU Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes some publications, program of Testimonial dinner; signed typescript of letter 1925 March lo from Alexander McAdie on Benjamin Franklin controversy. Some correspondence in regard to deposit of Papers and work on biography

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Early letters deal with medical school and career decisions.

Includes 1914 Certificate of registration as alien in England; 1929-30 appointment from Harvard as Research Fellow in Psychiatry and two letters April 1930 from I.S. Ravdin as to possible interest in a return to the University of Pennsylvania. Correspondence dealing with war-time attempt to form a group for research in aviation medicine with notes on possible subjects for study; correspondence dealing with request for delayed birth certificate. Primarily correspondence deals with matters of family health, housing, insurance, daughter's tuition.
Includes 1947 Dec. 18 election to New York Academy of Sciences and 1956 letter signed by D.D. Eisenhower on joining Committee of the Arts and Sciences for Eisenhower.

Correspondents include: Abell, Richard G.; Beck. James M.; Bond, Earl D.; Boots, Ralph H.; Bronk, Detlev W.; Hektoen, L.; Hoagland, Charles L.; Hogeboom, G.H.; Krumbhaar, Edward B.; Lewis, Paul Adin; Lewis. William Hall; Opie, Eugene L.; Pearce, Richard Mills; Ragle, B. Harrison; Ravdin, I.S.; Richards, A. Newton; Rockefeller, David; Taylor, Harden F.

Letters of congratulation on becoming Member of RIMR from: May Dwight, Frank Horsfall, Jr., Duncan MacInnes, Henry Parsons, W.J.V. Osterhout, Walter A. Jacobs, Robert A. Moore, John Kidd, Albert Casey, Philip Levine, D.W. Woolley.
Goebel, Walther. "Biographical Memoir," National Academy of Sciences, v. 50 (1979) 287-308 (2 copies).

did.unittitle: Princeton Class of 1914. Primarily Princeton University Foundation 1952-1956

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript signed letter, 1962 Jan. 1 from Detlev Bronk on future role for President of the Academy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters covering contributions from Rufus Cole, Simon Flexner, John Northrup, Eugene L. Opie, Frank Horsfall, Alfred E. Cohn.
Includes copy of remarks sent to Sir Christopher Andrews on work done with Rous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily recommendations for membership in the Century Club and Riverside Yacht Club. Condolence letters are drafts and recipients not always clear. Some recommendations for Heart Association Career Fellowships. Recommended for grants are: Boehme, Diethelm; Drury, Douglas R.; Harris, T.N.; Zweifach, Benjamin W.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes old time sheets and cancelled checks on money loaned.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous material including correspondence, recommendations and condolences. Letter from R.J. Bachvaroff is summary of laboratory experiences.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order: Bachvaroff, R.J.; Carter. Thelma; Gaghan, William J.; Kopech, G. (Mrs. Franzl); Leckband, Eva (Wolfe); Marchalonis, John; Morello, Josephine; Moser. Lawrence; Nikitovitch, Miroslava; Pomarico, John; Primosigh Joseph V.; Strum, Ernest; Szutu, Gloria; Van Cleve, James.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grants, reports of work done and manuscripts of published work or presentations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes some form announcements and 1952 Apr. 2 letter from David Rockefeller and 1952 May 20 copy of reply on future direction of RI on retirement of Herbert Gasser. Photocopy of 50 year certificate from RU 1969 Apr. 8, 1969 October reply to Frederick Seitz on outstanding "alumni" of laboratory and University and accomplishments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received. Consists of exchange of scientific information, requests for reprints and explanations of some laboratory techniques; invitations to serve on committees, requests for opinions on submitted manuscripts or grant requests; requests to prepare articles or present papers, sponsorship of papers, academic recommendations or award recommendations.

Correspondence arranged chronologically include: Abell, Richard ; Abramson, Harold A. ; Aronson, Joseph D. ; Aub, Joseph C. ; Batty, Irene ; Beard, Joseph W. ; Behney, Charles ; Benishek, Maria S. ; Birkhaug, Konrad E. ; Blalock, Alfred ; Blankenhorn, M.A. ; Bukantz, Samuel C. ; Burch, G.E. ; Coca, Arthur F. ; Coggeshall, L.T. ; Coons, Albert H. ; Cope, Oliver ; Cotzias, G.C. ; Cowdry, E.V. ; Custer, R.P. ; Cutler, John ; DeBakey, Michael ; Drinker, Cecil K. ; Drury, Douglas ; Dulaney, Anna Dean ; Eagle, Harry ; Ebert, James D. ; Edwards, Joshua ; Ehrich, William ; Elman, Robert ; Engel, George L. ; Farr, Lee E. ; Fanchini, Joseph ; Freund, Jules ; Friedenwald, W.F. ; Fulton, J.F. ; Furcolow, Michael L. ; Gabrieli, Elemer ; Gates, Thomas ; Goffman, John ; Gowans, J.L.; Graham, Evarts A. ; Griffith, John Q. ; Harris, T.N. ; Hertzman, Alrick B. ; Himwick, Harold E. ; Hinsey, Joseph C. ; Homans, John ; Hopkins, J.G. ; Hudack, S. ; Humphrey, J.H. ; Irwin, John W. ; Ivy, A.C. ; Kern, Richard A. ; Kukita, Kazuko; Landis, Eugene M. ; Langevoort, H.L. ; Latta, Harrison; Lederberg, Joshua; Lowenberg, Eugene L. ; Luck, J. Murray; Lurie, Max B. ; Lyon-Caen, L. ; McLean, Douglas; Maddock, Stephen; Miles, A.A. ; Minot, George R. ; Moon, V.H. ; Morgan, Herbert R. ; Parks, Edwards A. ; Parsons, Robert; Raffel, Sidney; Ragle, B. Harrison; Raddin, I.S. ; Rees, Leslie W. ; Robertson, J.S. ; Salin, Lothan; Samter, Max; Scheibel, Inga; Schlesinger, R. Walter; Schmidt, Carl F. ; Selye, Hans; Small, H.A. ; Smith, F. ; Smith, H.P. ; Sutliff, W.D. ; Taliaferro, William H. ; Thorbecke, G.J. ; Voigt, Wilhelm; Wade, H.W. ; Walker, Leonard A. ; Walser, MacKenzie; Wangensteen, Owen H. ; Weech, A.A. ; Wertheim, A.R. ; Wolbach, S. Bert; Wright, Irving Sherwood; Zweifach, Benj. W.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notes and protocols for staining techniques, preparation of dyes; production of antibodies; to make Saline Formalin; technique for peritoneal exudate; Feulgen reaction

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notes on and questions concerning techniques and results reported in published literature. Subjects include antibody formation, antigen tracers, aviation medicine, blood proteins, and the anamnestic reaction, corisone effects, sea sickness, skin absportion, spreading factors, trigger mechanisms.

did.unittitle: Notes on ideas found in published literature

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes ideas for experimental follow-up.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Filed as found but not labeled, sorted, or arranged.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of correspondence, special requests and allowances and budget sheets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes reports on minimum and optimum standards for care of laboratory animals; correspondence from faculty and copy of remarks made by Dr. McMaster 1958 January 6 meeting of "Animal House Committee".

did.unittitle: War work research period with Dr. Gasser

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of some final forms but primarily first drafts handwritten and edited copies.
Includes also draft of 1937-1938 illustrated report made to the Corporation.

did.unittitle: Laboratory records and notes on experiments

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some folders also include literature references and notes regarding points for discussion, for reports or for papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Records of experiments recorded on cards. Many with photographs (prints and negatives) and some slides.

Persistence of antigen and active anaphylaxis Series I-II

Persistence of antigen and antibody in HA color I
Swiss mice series for optimum "shocking dose", 1949, for intraperitoneal test; for anti pneumococcus serum; for horse serum, 1950
Cells vs Plasma; transfer of plain human albumin and or E-AP-H dye protein

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes readings by Merrill Chase and some notes of work done by son of P.D. McMaster called "Palook's exp.".

did.unittitle: Antigen in mouse blood. BRVR Exp. 1-35

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes experiments on non-precipitating antibody, 1955.

Use of active EVR-AnaS response for persistence of antigen
Hyperimmunity notes, discussion, checks to be run
Sensitivity of mouse transfer test for antibody

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Apr. 1955 experiment for non-precipitating antibodies.

did.unittitle: Cortisone experiments. History of G series Recipients and donors
Secondary response Decadron (SRD) 1959 Dec.-Jan. 1961 Secondary response to intra peritoneal particulate antigen under the influence of Decadron
Endotoxin; Comparison of intra venous and intra peritoneal methods in spleens and nodes; L-K phenomena

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Staff meeting presentations; student talks; lectures and symposia.
Handwritten and typewritten drafts and correspondence concerning arrangements.

did.unittitle: Group of handwritten notes of materials presented at staff meetings and later used for student talks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes introduction notes for Cecil Drinker's Harvey Lecture, notes for presentations of various talks where prepared paper not needed. Subjects include: urobilin, interstitial pressures, spread of dye with or without pressure or obstruction, human cutaneous phenomena, persistence of antigens, liver lymphatics, bile flow and anti-viral properties.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous notes and outlines used on assorted occasions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes transplantation immunity, tracer antigens, sites of antibody formation, mechanism of antibody formation.

did.unittitle: Drafts and corrected copy of three lectures to Florida students

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notes as used at various times with pages added and omitted 1956-1957 Florida talks finally presented in 1959.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript carbon, report on retirement dinner, copies of obituary and memorial material, correspondence with co-author, Michael Heidelberger, D.S. Bluemel. Also correspondence with former students and associates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 4 folders of literature notes, drafts and typescript carbon copy of manuscript for chapter in The Cell v. 5, edited by J. Brachet and A.E. Mirsky, 1961.

Includes Rous work on "Gradiant of vascular permeability" and McMaster work on "Lymphatics".

scopecontent.p: to Rous and McMaster glass plates

Photos used for chapter on "Antibody formation"
Photographs; University of Pennsylvania "Distinguished Senior Alumnus" citation
did.physdesc: 1 package containing oversize photographs and citation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: It is comprised of Correspondence between Dr. McMaster, Dr. Gasser, Dr. Bronk and Dr. Seitz. A few items are with other administration personnel and several letters are from Mrs. Elizabeth McMaster in setting up a lectureship fund in memory of her husband.
Several letters are concerned with provision for Dr. Franzl's situation when Dr. McMaster becomes Emeritus until Dr. Franzl decides on an appointment elsewhere.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Added in June 1980 from the Office of Faculty and Student records.
